issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: page level help button shows up on on attach volume to instance but no help displays and flip does not seem to be working, needs to be fixed to display buttons and flip to help on the rest of the volume and snapshot dialogs, and the tag editor dialog.
fields.summary: page level help not displaying for many modal dialogs

comments.body: reassigning to ean to take a look since david was stuck
[~dkavanagh] if you have info on this one can you leave it here in the comments so [~eans] has some ideas to start from, please?

In the last release, we didn't do flip on dialogs, we did a fade effect. I was trying to get flip working in the new dialogs, but I couldn't flip the dialog, and flipping internal panels didn't look good.
I had also implemented a "dialog_help" template to provide the "structure" help wanted. This is like what we used to provide in the old dialog DOM. I was using data-include in the template to pull that in, but decided to try pulling that in right in eucadialogview.js, so each template wouldn't need to worry about that import.
That's where I left it.

also, please be sure help when flipped picks up the same styling as the help when flipped ont he landing pages, for example. You can see if you flip the help on a landing page there is padding and styling for the headings that is not present in the launch instance wizard help when flipped, so that needs to be fixed and please be sure the dialog helps also pick up the padding and styling as well.
create security group help when flipped has the right styles, so if you can apply those to launch instance wizard and be sure the other dialogs have it as well that would be great.

I have fixed dialog help in the new dialogs. It required changes to the Flippy library. Originally, Flippy makes a copy of the DOM node you are flipping by calling html(). This will eliminate all event listeners and deactivate any interactive elements in the HTML. I modified the library to set the DOM nodes aside using detach() and later restore them, preserving their event listener state. We should try to get the patch accepted upstream.

I couldn't tell what the proper help was so I set it to "launch more's" URL and content. The line specifying those items is 139 in js/views/dialogs/create_volume_dialog.js. If Scott can fix that reference and then mimic the help setting in other dialogs that would be great. It should "just work".
Moving back into To Do so Scott can do his part, and then the help should work.
I think either David or Ean fixed this.
[~scottb], Ean's comment below makes it seem there is more work to be done for these. He created an example on one dialog I believe but the rest need to be made to point to their correct help files.

I haven't taken a look at what [~eans] added, but I would hope pulling from help.js is the solution. I pointed to that and I worked on the search path stuff there so we don't need symlinks anymore. Ean?
Actually, never mind. It does pull from help.js. Sorry for the confusion.
These are all fixed except for the add/edit tag dialog, which appears to be a special case. Email out to Ean for clarification.
reassigned to [~eans] to fix for Manage Tags. The rest of the dialogs are working and have been pushed to team/console/3.3 by [~scottb].
